  <script>// NOTE: This file gets included in Jade pre-transformed so it must be ES5-safe.
// we need to import this into our base HTML file as well as our main app scripts
// so we need to support a window global && (common || amd) imports
(function(global, factory) {
  if (typeof exports === 'object' && typeof module != 'undefined') {
    module.exports = factory();
  } else if (typeof define === 'function' && define.amd) {
    define(factory);
  } else {
    global.errorTracker = factory();
  }
}(this, function() {

  var lastError = {};

  function errorEquals(left, right) {
    return ['message', 'url', 'line', 'column'].every(function(field) {
      return left[field] == right[field];
    });
  }

  return function(tracker, options) {
    options = options || {};

    var logger = options.logger || (window && window.console) || {error: function() {}};
    var version = options.version || '';
    var versionTimestamp = options.versionTimestamp || '';

    var stringifyError = function(error) {
      var plainObject = {};
      if (error && typeof(error) == 'object') {
        Object.getOwnPropertyNames(error).forEach(function(key) {
          plainObject[key] = error[key];
        });
      }
      return JSON.stringify(plainObject);
    };

    var logClientSideError = function(message, url, line, column, error) {
      // errors without line numbers, urls or columns aren't helpful, chuck them
      if (!url || !column || !line) return;

      if (message.target && message.type) {
        message = message.type;
      }

      if (error && error.stack) {
        var findStackUrlRegExp = /\(([^)\s]+?):\d+:\d+\)/gm;
        var findLastStackUrlRegExp = /\s*(https?:\/\/[^:\s]+?):\d+:\d+\s*$/gm;
        var match;
        var local = true;

        // test for parens enclosed URLs in stack trace
        while (match = findStackUrlRegExp.exec(error.stack)) {
          if (match && !options.scriptFilter.test(match[1])) {
            local = false;
            break;
          }
        }

        // test for last URL in stack trace
        if (local) {
          while (match = findLastStackUrlRegExp.exec(error.stack)) {
            if (match && !options.scriptFilter.test(match[1])) {
              local = false;
              break;
            }
          }
        }

        // if stack trace shows us external scripts are buggy, don't log
        if (!local) return;
      }

      var errorStr = stringifyError(error);
      var errorDescrip = {
        message: message,
        script: url,
        line: line,
        url: window && window.document ? window.document.URL : url,
        column: column,
        error: errorStr,
        version: version,
        versionTimestamp: versionTimestamp,
        appName: window.appName || 'unknown'
      };

      logger.error(errorStr);

      var trackableUrl = url && (!options.scriptFilter || options.scriptFilter.test(url));

      if (trackableUrl) {
        var isNewError = !errorEquals(errorDescrip, lastError);

        // don't track the same error over and over again
        if (isNewError) {
          lastError = errorDescrip;
          tracker(errorDescrip);
        }
      }
    };

    if (typeof window !== 'undefined') {
      window.onerror = logClientSideError;
      if (window.errorTracker) {
        delete window.errorTracker;
      }
    } else {
      return logClientSideError;
    }
  };
}));
window._204 = [];
window._400 = [];
if(window.errorTracker) {
  window.errorTracker(
    function(error) {
      window._400.push({key:'page.error.javascript', value:error});
    },
    {
      scriptFilter: new RegExp('^/|^' + location.protocol + '//' + location.host),
      version:"a31f335ffb617277d7872852e6bc0eb1f5b7294a",
      versionTimestamp:"1507249392430"
    });
}</script>

  <style data-aphrodite>.SmartScrollWrapper_1g73uxh{min-width:360px;background-color:#ffffff;box-shadow:0 2px 4px 0 rgba(0,0,0,0.1);position:fixed;width:100%;left:0px;right:0px;top:0px;transition:top 0.2s ease-in-out;z-index:4000;-webkit-transition:top 0.2s ease-in-out;}.courseraLogoImage_wme5kp{width:127px;height:32px;}.switcherButton_6i293s-o_O-marginLeft_1r1hhef{margin-left:1rem;}.switcherButton_6i293s-o_O-marginLeft_1r1hhef:hover{text-decoration:none !important;color:#4a89dc;}.switcherButton_6i293s-o_O-marginLeft_1r1hhef:focus{outline:none;}.badge_1q250xd{margin-bottom:0.75rem;margin-right:1.125rem;}.badgeBox_1il9pec-o_O-Col_i9j08c-o_O-noGutterCol_18b9ep8-o_O-mdFlexWrapnowrap_eu553g-o_O-mdJustifycenter_3brwu6-o_O-lgJustifystart_yhslq8{display:-moz-box;display:-ms-flexbox;display:-webkit-box;display:-webkit-flex;display:flex;margin:1.5rem 0;justify-content:center;flex-wrap:wrap;position:relative;min-height:1px;width:100%;padding-left:0px;padding-right:0px;-webkit-justify-content:center;-webkit-flex-wrap:wrap;-ms-flex-wrap:wrap;-ms-flex-pack:center;-webkit-box-pack:center;-webkit-box-lines:multiple;}.badgeBox_1il9pec-o_O-Col_i9j08c-o_O-noGutterCol_18b9ep8-o_O-mdFlexWrapnowrap_eu553g-o_O-mdJustifycenter_3brwu6-o_O-lgJustifystart_yhslq8:after{content:;display:table;clear:both;}@media (min-width: 824px){.badgeBox_1il9pec-o_O-Col_i9j08c-o_O-noGutterCol_18b9ep8-o_O-mdFlexWrapnowrap_eu553g-o_O-mdJustifycenter_3brwu6-o_O-lgJustifystart_yhslq8{flex-wrap:nowrap;justify-content:center;-webkit-flex-wrap:nowrap;-ms-flex-wrap:nowrap;-webkit-justify-content:center;-webkit-box-lines:nowrap;-ms-flex-pack:center;-webkit-box-pack:center;}}@media (min-width: 1040px){.badgeBox_1il9pec-o_O-Col_i9j08c-o_O-noGutterCol_18b9ep8-o_O-mdFlexWrapnowrap_eu553g-o_O-mdJustifycenter_3brwu6-o_O-lgJustifystart_yhslq8{justify-content:flex-start;-webkit-justify-content:flex-start;-ms-flex-pack:start;-webkit-box-pack:start;}}</style>

  <script>!function(e){function __webpack_require__(r){if(t[r])return t[r].exports;var module=t[r]={i:r,l:!1,exports:{}};return e[r].call(module.exports,module,module.exports,__webpack_require__),module.l=!0,module.exports}var r=window.webpackJsonp;window.webpackJsonp=function webpackJsonpCallback(t,c,o){for(var a,u,i=0,p=[],b;i<t.length;i++)u=t[i],n[u]&&p.push(n[u][0]),n[u]=0;for(a in c)Object.prototype.hasOwnProperty.call(c,a)&&(e[a]=c[a]);for(r&&r(t,c,o);p.length;)p.shift()();if(o)for(i=0;i<o.length;i++)b=__webpack_require__(__webpack_require__.s=o[i]);return b};var t={},n={14:0};__webpack_require__.e=function requireEnsure(e){function onScriptComplete(){a.onerror=a.onload=null,clearTimeout(u);var r=n[e];0!==r&&(r&&r[1](new Error("Loading chunk "+e+" failed.")),n[e]=void 0)}var r=n[e];if(0===r)return new Promise(function(e){e()});if(r)return r[2];var t=new Promise(function(t,c){r=n[e]=[t,c]});r[2]=t;var c=document.getElementsByTagName("head")[0],o=function(e){return{"1":true,"2":true,"3":true,"4":true,"5":true,"8":true,"9":true,"14":true}[e]?"en."+e:e},a=document.createElement("script");a.type="text/javascript",a.charset="utf-8",a.async=!0,a.timeout=12e4,__webpack_require__.nc&&a.setAttribute("nonce",__webpack_require__.nc),a.src=__webpack_require__.p+""+o(e)+"."+{0:"90175b1888aa460496f4",1:"8d8e338700a34c784075",2:"136d1b372c11b9ae02aa",3:"d60ba3a46462c8bba1cf",4:"fcc0832d25657b9c01c0",5:"32c4d903f9e920600fd3",6:"f50d97626073ea3b4e72",7:"8f44162aea23c197c2e6",8:"b39041f44a367e07fb48",9:"0f342bc56174dd1d2308",10:"bbd6203d650bf043e998",11:"8e9583e6c5007415b70c",12:"27f495d99bb4206ea751",13:"723fbd19a1609731ceb2"}[e]+".js";var u=setTimeout(onScriptComplete,12e4);return a.onerror=a.onload=onScriptComplete,c.appendChild(a),t},__webpack_require__.m=e,__webpack_require__.c=t,__webpack_require__.d=function(exports,e,r){__webpack_require__.o(exports,e)||Object.defineProperty(exports,e,{configurable:!1,enumerable:!0,get:r})},__webpack_require__.n=function(module){var e=module&&module.__esModule?function getDefault(){return module.default}:function getModuleExports(){return module};return __webpack_require__.d(e,"a",e),e},__webpack_require__.o=function(e,r){return Object.prototype.hasOwnProperty.call(e,r)},__webpack_require__.p="https://d3njjcbhbojbot.cloudfront.net/webapps/builds/s12n-2016/",__webpack_require__.oe=function(e){throw console.error(e),e}}([]);</script>
  <script type="text/javascript" src="https://d3njjcbhbojbot.cloudfront.net/webapps/builds/s12n-2016/preloader.8f44162aea23c197c2e6.js" defer></script>
  <script type="text/javascript" src="https://d3njjcbhbojbot.cloudfront.net/webapps/builds/s12n-2016/loader.f50d97626073ea3b4e72.js" defer></script>

             <div class="enroll-button-inner bgcolor-white" data-reactid="84">
              <h1 class="display-2-text s12n-name" data-reactid="85"><span data-reactid="86">Full Stack Web and Multiplatform Mobile App Development Specialization</span></h1>
              <button data-track="true" data-track-app="specialization_ssr" data-track-page="landing" data-track-action="click" data-track-component="s12n_enroll_button" class="rc-S12nEnrollButton s12n-enroll comfy primary" data-reactid="87">

          <div class="rc-FinaidLink" data-reactid="91">
           <p class="caption-text" data-reactid="92"><span data-reactid="93">
             <!-- react-text: 94 -->Financial Aid is available for learners who cannot afford the fee. 
             <!-- /react-text --><button data-track="true" data-track-app="specialization_ssr" data-track-page="landing" data-track-action="click" data-track-component="finaid" class="button-link" data-reactid="95">Learn more and apply.</button></span></p>
          </div>
         </div>
        </section>
        <main class="bt3-col-sm-8 bt3-col-md-9" data-reactid="96">
         <div class="rc-Header bt3-row align-horizontal-center" data-reactid="97">
          <h2 class="s12n-headline display-6-text" data-reactid="98">Build Complete Web and Hybrid Mobile Solutions</h2>
          <h3 class="s12n-subheader headline-1-text" data-reactid="99">Master front-end web, hybrid mobile app and server-side development in five comprehensive courses.</h3>
         </div>
         <section id="about" class="rc-AboutS12n s12n-section" data-reactid="100">
          <div class="rc-SectionHeader" data-reactid="101">
           <h2 class="s12n-section-header-title" data-reactid="102">About This Specialization</h2>
          </div>
          <div class="description subsection" data-reactid="103">
           <div data-reactid="104">
            Learn front-end and hybrid mobile development, with server-side support, for implementing a multi-platform solution. The first two courses in this Specialization cover front-end frameworks: Bootstrap 4 and Angular. You’ll also learn to create hybrid mobile applications, using the Ionic framework, Cordova and NativeScript. On the server side, you’ll learn to implement NoSQL databases using MongoDB, work within a Node.js environment and Express framework, and communicate to the client side through a RESTful API. Learners enrolling in this Specialization are expected to have prior working knowledge of HTML, CSS and JavaScript. Ideally learners should complete the courses in the specified sequence. It is strongly recommended that the Angular course be completed before proceeding with the Ionic and Cordova and/or the NativeScript course.
           </div>
          </div>
          <div class="subsection creators horizontal-box wrap align-items-vertical-center" data-reactid="105">
           <p class="headline-1-text created-by" data-reactid="106">Created by:</p>
           <div class="rc-PartnerLogo" data-reactid="107">
            <img src="https://d3njjcbhbojbot.cloudfront.net/api/utilities/v1/imageproxy/https://coursera-university-assets.s3.amazonaws.com/0a/3251bd0aca5bc1a90512cff8bc36ea/ustLogo.png?auto=format%2Ccompress&amp;dpr=1&amp;w=200&amp;h=100&amp;fit=clip" srcset="https://d3njjcbhbojbot.cloudfront.net/api/utilities/v1/imageproxy/https://coursera-university-assets.s3.amazonaws.com/0a/3251bd0aca5bc1a90512cff8bc36ea/ustLogo.png?auto=format%2Ccompress&amp;dpr=2&amp;w=200&amp;h=100&amp;fit=clip 2x, https://d3njjcbhbojbot.cloudfront.net/api/utilities/v1/imageproxy/https://coursera-university-assets.s3.amazonaws.com/0a/3251bd0aca5bc1a90512cff8bc36ea/ustLogo.png?auto=format%2Ccompress&amp;dpr=3&amp;w=200&amp;h=100&amp;fit=clip 3x" class="partner-logo" style="max-width:200px;max-height:100px;" alt="The Hong Kong University of Science and Technology" data-reactid="108">
           </div>
          </div>
          <div class="subsection industry-partners horizontal-box wrap align-items-vertical-center" data-reactid="109"></div>
          <div class="rc-ValueProps horizontal-box" data-reactid="110">
           <div class="rc-ValuePropItem horizontal-box" data-reactid="111">
            <img width="72" height="72" src="https://d3njjcbhbojbot.cloudfront.net/web/bundles/s12n/assets/courses.svg" alt="courses" data-reactid="112">
            <div class="description-box" data-reactid="113">
             <h5 class="description-title color-primary-text headline-1-text" data-reactid="114">5 courses</h5>
             <p class="description-body color-secondary-text body-1-text" data-reactid="115">Follow the suggested order or choose your own.</p>
            </div>
           </div>
           <div class="rc-ValuePropItem horizontal-box" data-reactid="116">
            <img width="72" height="72" src="https://d3njjcbhbojbot.cloudfront.net/web/bundles/s12n/assets/projects.svg" alt="projects" data-reactid="117">
            <div class="description-box" data-reactid="118">
             <h5 class="description-title color-primary-text headline-1-text" data-reactid="119">Projects</h5>
             <p class="description-body color-secondary-text body-1-text" data-reactid="120">Designed to help you practice and apply the skills you learn.</p>
            </div>
           </div>
           <div class="rc-ValuePropItem horizontal-box" data-reactid="121">
            <img width="72" height="72" src="https://d3njjcbhbojbot.cloudfront.net/web/bundles/s12n/assets/certificate.svg" alt="certificates" data-reactid="122">
            <div class="description-box" data-reactid="123">
             <h5 class="description-title color-primary-text headline-1-text" data-reactid="124">Certificates</h5>
             <p class="description-body color-secondary-text body-1-text" data-reactid="125">Highlight your new skills on your resume or LinkedIn.</p>
            </div>
           </div>
          </div>
          <div data-reactid="126">
           <p class="projects-overview headline-1-text" data-reactid="127">Projects Overview</p>
           <div class="rc-TogglableContent projects-overview-toggle collapsed" data-reactid="128">
            <div class="content" style="height:64px;" data-reactid="129">
             <div class="content-inner" data-reactid="130">
              <div class="rc-CML styled" data-reactid="131">
               <div data-reactid="132">
                <p>Learners will work on hands-on exercises, culminating in development of a full-fledged application at the end of each course. Each course also includes a mini-Capstone Project as part of the Honors Track where you’ll apply your skills to build a fully functional project.</p>
               </div>
              </div>
             </div>
            </div>
           </div>
          </div>
         </section>
         <section id="courses" class="rc-Courses" data-reactid="133">
          <div class="rc-SectionHeader" data-reactid="134">
           <div class="s12n-section-header-title" data-reactid="135">
            Courses
           </div>
          </div>
          <div class="s12n-level-container horizontal-box align-items-absolute-center" data-reactid="136">
           <i class="rc-Icon icon-level-intermediate s12n-level-icon" data-reactid="137"><span class="path1" data-reactid="138"></span><span class="path2" data-reactid="139"></span><span class="path3" data-reactid="140"></span><span class="path4" data-reactid="141"></span><span class="path5" data-reactid="142"></span><span class="path6" data-reactid="143"></span><span class="path7" data-reactid="144"></span></i>
           <dl class="s12n-level-description-container horizontal-box" data-reactid="145">
            <dt data-reactid="146">
             Intermediate Specialization.
            </dt>
            <dd class="s12n-level-description" data-reactid="147">
             Some related experience required.
            </dd>
           </dl>
          </div>
          <ol class="nostyle" data-reactid="148">
           <li data-reactid="149">
            <section class="rc-Course bgcolor-white" data-reactid="150">
             <h3 class="course-number-cont body-2-text" data-reactid="151"><span data-reactid="152">COURSE 1</span></h3>
             <div class="course-cont" data-reactid="153">
              <h2 class="course-name headline-5-text" data-reactid="154">Front-End Web UI Frameworks and Tools: Bootstrap 4</h2>
              <div class="course-start-date" data-reactid="155">
               <span data-reactid="156">Upcoming session: Oct 15</span>
              </div>
              <dl class="basic-info-row horizontal-box" data-reactid="157">
               <dt class="info-label body-1-text flex-4" data-reactid="158">
                Commitment
               </dt>
               <dd class="info-text body-2-text flex-8" data-reactid="159">
                4 weeks of study, 4-6 hours/week
               </dd>
              </dl>
              <dl class="basic-info-row horizontal-box" data-reactid="160">
               <dt class="info-label body-1-text flex-4" data-reactid="161">
                Subtitles
               </dt>
               <dd class="info-text body-2-text flex-8" data-reactid="162">
                English
               </dd>
              </dl>
              <div class="description-cont" data-reactid="163">
               <h3 class="headline-3-text" data-reactid="164">About the Course</h3>
               <div class="body-1-text" data-reactid="165">
                <div data-reactid="166">
                 <span data-reactid="167">
                  <!-- react-text: 168 -->This course will give you an overview of client-side web UI frameworks, in particular Bootstrap 4. You will learn about grids and responsive design, Bootstrap CSS and JavaScript components. You will learn about CSS preprocessors, Less and Sass. 
                  <!-- /react-text --><button data-track="true" data-track-app="specialization_ssr" data-track-page="landing" data-track-action="click" data-track-component="show_course_syllabus" class="button-link" aria-expanded="false" data-reactid="169">... more</button></span>

                   <!-- react-text: 173 --> 
                   <!-- /react-text --><a data-click-key="specialization_ssr.landing.click.link_to_cdp" data-click-value="{&quot;namespace&quot;:{&quot;app&quot;:&quot;specialization_ssr&quot;,&quot;page&quot;:&quot;landing&quot;,&quot;component&quot;:&quot;link_to_cdp&quot;,&quot;action&quot;:&quot;click&quot;},&quot;s12nId&quot;:&quot;Tn_VM61TEeaH0xIrfa92QA&quot;,&quot;courseId&quot;:&quot;B7S6P6yjEeaPvQ5eOPtN_A&quot;,&quot;schema_type&quot;:&quot;FRONTEND&quot;,&quot;href&quot;:&quot;/learn/bootstrap-4&quot;}" data-track="true" data-track-app="specialization_ssr" data-track-page="landing" data-track-action="click" data-track-component="link_to_cdp" data-track-href="/learn/bootstrap-4" href="/learn/bootstrap-4" to="/learn/bootstrap-4" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer" data-reactid="174">Learn more.</a></span></p>

           <li data-reactid="253">
            <section class="rc-Course bgcolor-white" data-reactid="254">
             <h3 class="course-number-cont body-2-text" data-reactid="255"><span data-reactid="256">COURSE 5</span></h3>
             <div class="course-cont" data-reactid="257">
              <h2 class="course-name headline-5-text" data-reactid="258">Server-side Development with NodeJS, Express and MongoDB</h2>
              <div class="course-start-date" data-reactid="259">
               <span data-reactid="260">Starts October 2017</span>
              </div>
              <dl class="basic-info-row horizontal-box" data-reactid="261">
               <dt class="info-label body-1-text flex-4" data-reactid="262">
                Commitment
               </dt>
               <dd class="info-text body-2-text flex-8" data-reactid="263">
                4 weeks of study, 6-8 hours/week
               </dd>
              </dl>
              <dl class="basic-info-row horizontal-box" data-reactid="264">
               <dt class="info-label body-1-text flex-4" data-reactid="265">
                Subtitles
               </dt>
               <dd class="info-text body-2-text flex-8" data-reactid="266">
                English
               </dd>
              </dl>
              <div class="description-cont" data-reactid="267">
               <h3 class="headline-3-text" data-reactid="268">About the Course</h3>
               <div class="body-1-text" data-reactid="269">
                <div data-reactid="270">
                 <span data-reactid="271">This course deals with all things server-side. We base the entire course around the NodeJS platform. We start with a brief overview of the Web protocols: HTTP and HTTPS. We examine NodeJS and NodeJS modules: Express for building web servers. On the database side, we review basic CRUD operations, NoSQL databases, in particular MongoDB and Mongoose for accessing MongoDB from NodeJS. We examine the REST concepts and building a RESTful API. We touch upon authentication and security. Finally we review backend as a service (BaaS) approaches, including mobile BaaS, both open-source and commercial BaaS services. At the end of this course, you will be able to: - Demonstrate an understanding of server-side concepts, CRUD and REST - Build and configure a backend server using NodeJS framework - Build a RESTful API for the front-end to access backend services</span>
                 <p class="link-to-cdp" data-reactid="272"><span data-reactid="273"><strong data-reactid="274">You can choose to take this course only.</strong>
                   <!-- react-text: 275 --> 
                   <!-- /react-text --><a data-click-key="specialization_ssr.landing.click.link_to_cdp" data-click-value="{&quot;namespace&quot;:{&quot;app&quot;:&quot;specialization_ssr&quot;,&quot;page&quot;:&quot;landing&quot;,&quot;component&quot;:&quot;link_to_cdp&quot;,&quot;action&quot;:&quot;click&quot;},&quot;s12nId&quot;:&quot;Tn_VM61TEeaH0xIrfa92QA&quot;,&quot;courseId&quot;:&quot;pn1erK4cEeaP-Q4_2QdcFg&quot;,&quot;schema_type&quot;:&quot;FRONTEND&quot;,&quot;href&quot;:&quot;/learn/server-side-nodejs&quot;}" data-track="true" data-track-app="specialization_ssr" data-track-page="landing" data-track-action="click" data-track-component="link_to_cdp" data-track-href="/learn/server-side-nodejs" href="/learn/server-side-nodejs" to="/learn/server-side-nodejs" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer" data-reactid="276">Learn more.</a></span></p>
                </div>
               </div>
              </div>
             </div>
            </section></li>
          </ol>
         </section>

      <div class="rc-S12nGoogleSchemaMarkup" data-reactid="342">
       <div data-reactid="343"> 
        <script type="application/ld+json">

You’ll also learn to create hybrid mobile applications, using the Ionic framework, Cordova and NativeScript. On the server side, you’ll learn to implement NoSQL databases using MongoDB, work within a Node.js environment and Express framework, and communicate to the client side through a RESTful API. Learners enrolling in this Specialization are expected to have prior working knowledge of HTML, CSS and JavaScript.\n\nIdeally learners should complete the courses in the specified sequence. This course will use Typescript for developing Angular application. Typescript features will be introduced in the context of Angular as part of the exercises. You will also get an introduction to the use of Angular Material and Angular Flex-Layout for responsive UI design. You will be introduced to various aspects of Angular including components, directives and services. You will learn about data binding, Angular router and its use for developing single-page applications. You will also learn about designing both template-driven forms and reactive forms. A quick introduction to Observables, reactive programming and RxJS in the context of Angular is included. You will then learn about Angular support for client-server communication and the use of REST API on the server side. You will use Restangular for communicating with a server supporting the REST API. A quick tour through Angular animation support and Angular testing rounds off the course. You must have either completed the previous course in the specialization on Bootstrap 4, or have a working knowledge of front end web-UI frameworks to be able to navigate this course. Also a good working knowledge of JavaScript, especially ES 5 is strongly recommended.\n\nAt the end of this course you will:\n\n- Be familiar with client-side Javascript frameworks and the Angular framework\n- Be able to implement single page applications in Angular\n- Be able to use various Angular features including directives, components and services\n- Be able to implement a functional front-end web application using Angular\n- Be able to use Angular Material and Angular Flex-Layout for designing responsive Angular applications\n- Be able to use Observables and RxJS in the context of Angular applications","plannedLaunchDate":"June 12, 2017","primaryLanguages":["en"],"slug":"angular","startDate":1497290021087,"subtitleLanguages":[],"timeCommitment":null,"upcomingSessionStartDate":1508137200000,"v2Details":null,"v2Details.v1(plannedLaunchDate,sessionsEnabledAt)":null,"workload":"4 weeks of study, 6-8 hours\u002Fweek","courseType":"v2.ondemand","id":"7KOMkK4bEeaXlg7d4yL0LA","name":"Front-End JavaScript Frameworks: Angular"},"aR-uTK4cEeaHBgqkZt_jWA":{"courseMode":"SESSION","courseStatus":"launched","description":"This course focuses on developing truly cross-platform, native iOS and Android apps using NativeScript (Ver 3.x). The framework uses Angular, TypeScript or modern JavaScript to get truly native UI and performance while sharing skills and code with the web. You will learn about UI development with NativeScript UI and layout support and access the native mobile platform's capabilities from Javascript. You should have already completed the Bootstrap 4 and the Angular courses in this specialization before proceeding with this course.\n\nAt the end of this course you will be able to (a) Build mobile applications targeting multiple platforms with a single codebase, (b) Leverage your Angular, TypeScript and Javascript skills, and (c) Use various features of the Ionic framework to build truly cross-platform mobile applications","plannedLaunchDate":"July 24, 2017","primaryLanguages":["en"],"slug":"nativescript","startDate":1500879783807,"subtitleLanguages":[],"timeCommitment":null,"upcomingSessionStartDate":1508137200000,"v2Details":null,"v2Details.v1(plannedLaunchDate,sessionsEnabledAt)":null,"workload":"4 weeks of study, 6-8 hours\u002Fweek","courseType":"v2.ondemand","id":"aR-uTK4cEeaHBgqkZt_jWA","name":"Multiplatform Mobile App Development with NativeScript"},"B7S6P6yjEeaPvQ5eOPtN_A":{"courseMode":"SESSION","courseStatus":"launched","description":"This course will give you an overview of client-side web UI frameworks, in particular Bootstrap 4. You will learn about grids and responsive design, Bootstrap CSS and JavaScript components. You will learn about CSS preprocessors, Less and Sass. You will also learn the basics of Node.js and NPM and task runners like Grunt and Gulp.\nAt the end of this course, you will be able to a)Set up, design and style a web page using Bootstrap 4 and its components, b) Create a responsive web page design, and c) Make use of web tools to setup and manage web sites.\nThis course also includes an honors track that enables you to work on your own project developing a website using Bootstrap 4.\nStudents enrolling in this course should have prior good working knowledge of HTML, CSS and JavaScript.","plannedLaunchDate":"June 12, 2017","primaryLanguages":["en"],"slug":"bootstrap-4","startDate":1497290001848,"subtitleLanguages":[],"timeCommitment":null,"upcomingSessionStartDate":1508137200000,"v2Details":null,"v2Details.v1(plannedLaunchDate,sessionsEnabledAt)":null,"workload":"4 weeks of study, 4-6 hours\u002Fweek","courseType":"v2.ondemand","id":"B7S6P6yjEeaPvQ5eOPtN_A","name":"Front-End Web UI Frameworks and Tools: Bootstrap 4"},"QJATKa4cEeaHBgqkZt_jWA":{"courseMode":"SESSION","courseStatus":"launched","description":"This course focuses on developing multiplatform mobile applications using the Web technologies (HTML5, CSS and Javascript). In particular we make use of the Cordova hybrid application framework to develop and target multiple mobile platforms with a single codebase. We make use of the Ionic framework (Ionic Ver 3.x), one of the most popular mobile application frameworks, that is built with mobile-optimized HTML5 and CSS based components and Angular. You will learn about UI development with Ionic and then using Cordova's modules to access the native mobile platform's capabilities from Javascript. You should have already completed the Bootstrap 4 and the Angular courses in this specialization before proceeding with this course.\n\nAt the end of this course you will be able to (a) Build mobile applications targeting multiple platforms with a single codebase, (b) Leverage your HTML5, CSS, Javascript and Angular skills, and (c) Use various features of the Ionic framework to build hybrid mobile applications","plannedLaunchDate":"June 12, 2017","primaryLanguages":["en"],"slug":"ionic-cordova","startDate":1497290039350,"subtitleLanguages":[],"timeCommitment":null,"upcomingSessionStartDate":1508137200000,"v2Details":null,"v2Details.v1(plannedLaunchDate,sessionsEnabledAt)":null,"workload":"4 weeks of study, 6-8 hours\u002Fweek","courseType":"v2.ondemand","id":"QJATKa4cEeaHBgqkZt_jWA","name":"Multiplatform Mobile App Development with Web Technologies: Ionic and Cordova"},"pn1erK4cEeaP-Q4_2QdcFg":{"courseMode":"SESSION","courseStatus":"preenroll","description":"This course deals with all things server-side. We base the entire course around the NodeJS platform. We start with a brief overview of the Web protocols: HTTP and HTTPS. We examine NodeJS and NodeJS modules: Express for building web servers. On the database side, we review basic CRUD operations, NoSQL databases, in particular MongoDB and Mongoose for accessing MongoDB from NodeJS. We examine the REST concepts and building a RESTful API. We touch upon authentication and security. Finally we review backend as a service (BaaS) approaches, including mobile BaaS, both open-source and commercial BaaS services.\n\nAt the end of this course, you will be able to:\n\n- Demonstrate an     window.detectedTimezone = "America/Argentina/Buenos_Aires";
    window.ssr = true;
  
</script>
  <script>var loadScript = function(url, success, async) {
  var newScript = document.createElement('script');
  var scripts = document.getElementsByTagName('script');
  
  newScript.type = 'text/javascript';
  newScript.async = async || false;
  newScript.crossOrigin = 'anonymous';
  
  if (success) {
    if (newScript.addEventListener) {
      newScript.addEventListener('load', function() {
       success();
      }, false);
    } else if(newScript.readyState) {
      newScript.onreadystatechange = function() {
        if (this.readyState == 'complete') {
          newScript.onreadystatechange = null;
          success();
        }
      };
    }
  }
  
  if (scripts && scripts.length) {
    var lastScript = scripts[scripts.length - 1];
    lastScript.parentNode.insertBefore(newScript, lastScript.nextSibling);
  } else if (window.document && window.document.body) {
    window.document.body.appendChild(newScript);
  }
  
  // IE9 will execute the proper order if src is set AFTER injection
  newScript.src = url;
}

window.coursera = {};
window.appName = "s12n-2016";
</script>
  <script>coursera.config = (function() {
 var config = JSON.parse('{"gapi_eventing_data":{"project_number":"274249572679","api_key":"","client_id":"274249572679-al8nc3ttcavj0n91due232a3h6s3r9vk.apps.googleusercontent.com"},"bigquery":{"dataset":"mydataset","table_prefix":"livedata_"},"dir":{"home":"/"},"version":"a31f335ffb617277d7872852e6bc0eb1f5b7294a","versionTimestamp":"1507249392430","debug":false,"compress":true,"optimize":true,"environment":"production","log":"error","url":{"api":"/maestro/api/","maestro":"/maestro/api/","base":"https://www.coursera.org/","cloudfront_api":"https://d1hpa2gdx2lr6r.cloudfront.net/maestro/api/","accounts":"https://accounts.coursera.org/","assets":"https://d3njjcbhbojbot.cloudfront.net/web/","resource_assets":"https://coursera_assets.s3.amazonaws.com/","app_assets":"https://d3njjcbhbojbot.cloudfront.net/web/","imageProxyRoot":"https://d3njjcbhbojbot.cloudfront.net/api/utilities/v1/imageproxy/"}}');
 if (config) {
   // requesters country of origin, injected by edge
   // in the following format https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_3166-1_alpha-2
   config.requestCountryCode = 'AR';
   return config;
 } else {
   return {};
 }
})();/* global coursera */
// Provide a string that will be replaced by edge.
// Make sure to use double quotes because edge only escapes double quotes.
// Then check that edge actually did the replacement.
// Otherwise return an empty object.
// You must use double quotes for the injected string
coursera.epicOverrides = (function() {
  var injectedString =     return {};
  }

  var epicResponse = injectedString && injectedString !== undefined ? JSON.parse(injectedString) : {};
  return epicResponse.elements || {};
})();
/* globals coursera */
/* eslint-disable quotes */
coursera.user = (function() {
  var userJson = "undefined";
  try {
    return JSON.parse(userJson);
  } catch (e) {
    return {};
  }
})();
/* globals coursera*/
// Defines a named AMD module containing the course ID
coursera.courseId = (function() {
  return '{{ ONDEMAND_COURSE_ID_PLACEHOLDER }}';
})();
</script>
  <!--[if lte IE 9]><script>var queueScript = function(scripts, callback) {
  return function() {
    if (scripts.length > 1) {
      loadScript(scripts.shift(), queueScript(scripts, callback));
    } else {
      loadScript(scripts.shift(), callback);
    }
  }
};

var queue = function(scripts, callback) {
  queueScript(scripts, callback)();
}

var scripts = [
  'https://d3njjcbhbojbot.cloudfront.net/web/bundles/vendor/Intl.js.v0-1-4/Intl.en-US.js',
  
    https://d3njjcbhbojbot.cloudfront.net/webapps/builds/s12n-2016/preloader.8f44162aea23c197c2e6.js,
  
    https://d3njjcbhbojbot.cloudfront.net/webapps/builds/s12n-2016/loader.f50d97626073ea3b4e72.js,
  
  ''
];
scripts.pop(); // remove the last element, since it is empty due to template oddities...

queue(scripts, function() {});</script><![endif]--> 
  <!--[if !IE]> -->
  <script>if (!window.JSON) {
  loadScript('https://d3njjcbhbojbot.cloudfront.net/web/js/vendor/json2.js');
}

if (!window.Intl) {
  loadScript('https://d3njjcbhbojbot.cloudfront.net/web/bundles/vendor/Intl.js.v0-1-4/Intl.en-US.js');
}
</script>
